subject: Gardening
title: Roman Villa Gardens
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Roman Villa Gardens.

hook.text: When Vesuvius buried Pompeii, it preserved Roman gardens in volcanic ash for 2,000 years.

buildup.text: Romans turned gardens into outdoor living rooms with fountains, frescoed walls, and dining couches.

discovery.text: Pliny the Younger wrote detailed letters about his gardenâ€”history's first garden design journal.

twist.text: Even cramped Pompeii shops had tiny garden rooms. Green space was a Roman non-negotiable.

climax.text: Root cavities in Pompeii's ash let archaeologists plant exactly what Romans grew, 2,000 years later.

punchline.text: A volcano became history's best garden archivist.

quiz.question: How did archaeologists reconstruct Roman gardens in Pompeii?
options: They used root cavities preserved in volcanic ash
They followed instructions in surviving Roman law codes
They copied garden designs from Roman coins
